results.title: Negotiate like the pros. Vol. 4
results.brief_description: Never pay too much, settle for too little or give in too soon again! This seminar presentation by John Patrick Doolan looks at how to get what you want from negotiations. What you’ll learn includes ways to make your brainstorming sessions even more productive, dealing with emotional outbursts at the bargaining table and avoiding the 13 mistakes amatueur negotiators make.

results.title: Negotiate like the pros. Vol. 3
results.brief_description: Never pay too much, settle for too little or give in too soon again! This seminar presentation with John Patrick Dolan looks at what to do when things break down. Learn the main reason negotiations break down, and how to prevent it, when arbitration is a good idea and how to negotiate a deal from a weak position.

results.title: Negotiate like the pros. Vol. 1
results.brief_description: Never pay too much, settle for too little or give in too soon again! Presented by John Patrick Dolan, this seminar outlines the keys to effective deal making. Negotiation means getting what you want in a way that is fair and respectful to the all parties. Stressing the importance of skills such as the the basics of setting ground rules before beginning, listen first, talk last, how to use questions as crowbars why and how to focus on your interests as opposed to your your position and the one thing not to divulge during any negotiation this video will help you become the negotiator you’ve always dreamed you could be!

results.brief_description: Five members of the Victorian Printmakers Group present various techniques of printmaking, including colour etching, lino cuts, and stone lithography.

results.title: Need for supervisory training
results.creator_credit: Ronald H. Riley, Verity Films and David H. Villiers
results.brief_description: The film deals with eight identical production lines in a factory each doing the same work using the same machinery employing the same number of workers and each receiving the same flow of materials. Theoretically each production line should produce at the same rate but this does not prove to be the case. The film endeavours to find the correct solution by tracing from the managing director’s office right through to the works for the cause of this unequal production.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ronald H. Riley, Verity Films and David H. Villiers

results.title: Ned Wethered
results.brief_description: Memories of the times spent with a family friend Ned Wethered, when the filmmaker was a child, make up this film. The piecing together of these memories, the soft drawings of the animation and a piece of music, composed by Ned Wethered, playing in the background all help the film to portray a sensitive story of this man’s life.

results.title: Ned Kelly: The Making of a Myth (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Presents reasons why Ned Kelly is one of the most infamous Australians in history. Although labelled as a bushranger and murderer, he was still a hero and leader to the destitute selectors in rural north-east Victoria. Features the works of Sidney Nolan whose many versions of the legend are perhaps the most familiar Kelly images. Irish actor and broadcaster, T. P. McKenna: Irish political activist, Bernadette Devlin: painter, Sidney Nolan: Australian historian, John McQuillon: and filmmaker and Kelly expert, Ian Jones are all interviewed. Written by Thomas Keneally.

results.title: Ned Kelly (VR)
results.brief_description: Ian MacLarty’s Ned Kelly VR game, made in Vertex Meadow, lets players inhabit the limited view of the famous bushranger’s iconic helmet.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.
